Reviews.Title: “I can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel in excellent position for all the sights. Staff very friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. I stayed in a single room, which was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. The only complaint was that we were late to breakfast on the first morning, and we had to come back twice as there were no tables, and there was hardly any choice left. Happy hour between hours of 6-8pm was a nice touch. We came over for the Rome Marathon and could not have been in a better positioned hotel . Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A small, central hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Donna_mairead
Reviews.Content: Travelled here on 8th February during adverse weather conditions in Rome. Some days it snowed and evenings were very cold. Hotel is in a very central location. Just off via nazionale! Hotel is small (like most hotels in Rome). The rooms are not located within the reception entrance. You will need to go next door to get to your room. Rooms were tiny. We did hear a lot of noise in the morning from cleaners and other guests. The shower is oh so small! I didn't have a problem but my other half complained about it a lot. Breakfast was small but fine. Breakfast finishes at 9.30am! This is too early!! I hope they rethink this and change it to at least 10am. The coffee served at breakfast was lovely!! The two girls who serve the teas/coffees are brilliant! There are some lovely perks about this hotel. Happy hour 6-8pm free drinks and crisps provided. We stayed here over Valentines and a card and porcelain heart shaped gift box with chocolates inside was left in our room that day. I thought this was very thoughtful! I would definitely stay here again, if they would sound proof the walls...

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TJEA
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we were not disappointed by Hotel Caravaggio. It was well situated for the areas we wished to visit and we felt safe wandering well into the evening. The staff were extremely friendly and our room and ensuite were immaculate. We have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the cold winters”
Reviews.Author: capdail2006
Reviews.Content: Before you make a reservation to stay in this hotel in the winter call ahead and ask the reception about the following issues: - Which building number and room number will you be located if you reserve the room? From what I have seen, the room numbers with even numbers up to 30 are located on the first floor of the building right above the reception (although they have separate entrance points – throughout the day and night, receptionists open the main building door automatically for you to enter the room). Some reviewers are not sure if they stayed in the same building as others who wrote pleasant reviews (our stay in the floor above the reception was pleasant). - If you will not stay alone, you may want to confirm that they can give you two sets of keys to enter the room (this was not the case on our recent visit – one key per room, regardless of the number of guests in it) - If the weather is likely to be very cold during your stay, be aware that the heating system is not on during many hours of the day and night – ask ahead to learn when it will be on, depending on when you plan to be in the room. - If you want to see TV channels in languages other than Italian, ask if they have added any new channels to the in-room television. - Ask if the renovation work in another building in the same block is completed, as this caused noise one morning starting at 7.15 Am on our recent visit. Once you arrive, since they expect to be paid at the time of check-in, be sure to ask them to show your room before making the payment – this is your right. Overall, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Olivia H
Reviews.Content: We had room 34, which looked out onto the street below. The room was massive: you could have fit a dining room table in there as well as the large bed. We received a free bottle of wine on arrival, which was the perfect touch. The bathroom is a bit small, with a tiny shower, but it was clean, which is all I need. We had noisy neighbours, which isn't ideal, who decided to ignore the no smoking signs, so every night we received an awful smell of cigarette smoke - not the hotel's fault though. Breakfast is poor. It was only breads, jam and croissants. There were a few pieces of fruit, but they didn't look that edible. There are only about 10 tables in the breakfast area, which were definitely not enough to accommodate all the people staying there, so we had to wait a bit to get a table. However the staff working at breakfast are lovely, so they make it a bit more enjoyable. Every evening (well supposed to be every evening, but we realised it was dependent on which staff member was working) they provided a 6-8pm happy hour, with chips, juice and sparkling wine, absolutely free of charge. This worked well, because we used the free WiFi (only available in reception) around that time, after coming back from sight seeing and before going out for dinner, so received some nibbles too. The hotel is located perfectly for all of Rome's sights. There are some really lovely restaurants on the main road (one parallel from the street Hotel Caravaggio is on), which I would suggest going to, rather than the ones immediately close by to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sanja M
Reviews.Content: The loveliest place, the heart of Rome, beautiful and pleasant hotel Caravaggio offers everything a tourist needs when in Rome. The hotel is located near every attraction one NEEDS to visit- Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna, Piazza navona, Coloseum, Pantheon, Forum Romanum, Galeria Borghese. The hotel is also near Vatican and san Pietro basilic... you can go there by foot, because the furthest location is one metro station away. The hotel staff is friendly and ready to help if you have any doubts or difficulties. You can call them anytime and they will be there to give you any instruction needed. Our room was beautiful and full of warmth. The breakfast was lovely, too. I'm looking forward to staz at this hotel again next time I visit Rome. I LOVE Rome!

Reviews.Title: “This is in an apartment block ..”
Reviews.Author: Korinamcintyre
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a short trip with my mum - we are 29 and 53. The location is ideal if using the aiport bus and is close, within walking distance to the colosseum and roman forum. The street the hotel is situated on is fairly quiet. We had booked a twin room and on arriving (at 11pm) were shown to a double room, when i explained to the staff and showed them my reservation I was told that twin meant two people and the bed was adequate. After refusing to pay he agreed that we would sleep in the double room that night and move in the morning as all other rooms were full. I am 5ft 2" and 57kg - i could barely fit in the shower, i could get in there and stand still but bending down to get the soap meant my skin touched the filthy shower curtain, so if you are any bigger than this then good luck. Also whilst in the shower the light - which is on a timer - switched itself off so i'd to get out and turn it back on again. Breakfast was right outside our room - literally we could open the door and touch a breakfast chair - so we were up bring and early the next morning to move rooms. On returning - our things had been moved to the new room, this room was much bigger and brighter and the bathroom had improved ten fold, as had the member of staff on the reception desk - so I guess it depends what room you are in in the hotel and if the staff can be bothered doing their job. The lift is gorgeous - its original and very beautiful - however we were only on the first floor so no need to use it. this is the only good thing about the stairwell though - otherwise there is lose wiring in junction boxes that are open, the stairwell is dirty and at the main entrance there are garbage bins that stink. The hotel does not own the whole bulding - there are other people who have apartments in this block. If i were to return to Rome i'd try else - this would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the caravaggio”
Reviews.Author: Robbievikings
Reviews.Content: My partner and i are currently staying at the Caravaggio hotel, in room 22 and thoroughly enjoying our stay. The hotel is situated on a quiet street in the centre of Rome and the hotel staff are very good, they look after you and nothing is too much trouble. A good continental breakfast good variety and a firm but comfortable bed and a nice room with shower,tv,fridge.There is also a fantastic 80 year old lift which is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma H
Reviews.Content: Our stay was during August 2011, and we thought the hotel perfectly suited all our needs. Perfectly situated, it is reasonable walking distance to all major tourist destinations and surrounded by a variety of cafes and restuarants of varied prices. The staff are helpful and friendly, and we were surprised by the generous size of the rooms. Breakfast was enjoyable, even if the dining area is a little cramped, with a continental buffet and a table service for coffee. The coffee was great! There was very little noise pollution to the rooms, bathrooms were clean and basic, and beds were very comfortable. The AC was invaluable at this time of year - in one of our rooms we had a little trouble adjusting it, but the staff were helpful in rectifying this, and in all other queries and needs we had. It was also helpful to have access to the internet at reception. All in all, we thought this hotel was a real gem for tourists who are trying to do Rome on a budget. There is a great bakery round the corner that is open in the morning and sells great pizza breads for lunch, and a lovely restuarant on the street with genuine Italian character. There is also helpfully a cash machine just around the block. We had a lovely, comfortable stay and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: emmieloub
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel perfect for sight seeing and local meals, the location is ideal for all major tourist spots. Very freindly staff and breakfast is perfect way to set you up for all the walking you will do. Very happy with our stay will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: asmik_nagapetyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Caravaggio for 6 nights. The best thing is that it is near all the well known sights of the city, so you can walk. Also it is in 10 minutes walk from Termini. The room was small, but it is Ok for travelling. The staff is very polite and friendly. The breakfast was fine, the girl working there was nice, too. The check out is at 11.00 am but you can leave your luggage at the reception for a longer time. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected..Nice decor”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBlueBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Caravaggio for one night, for work.. I love Caravaggio paintings, so... Initially didn't mean to stay at this hotel but ended up here because my preferred hotel near Termini was fully booked. The name sounded right, price reasonable, the location wasn't too far from Termini and the deco looked nice from the pics. Reviews were reasonably ok, so i give it a try. And was an choice i don't regret. The room was small but for Rome standards still ok (i saw worse). it is charming meaning it has a style and personality with nice furniture a beautiful mosaic tile floor. Cupboard is also very small but ok for one night. Corrifors have Caravaggio painting replicas.. if you like it, at Villa Borghese and in Piazza del Popolo you can admire some of the original ones.. I did not stay for the breakfast but it looked like it would be nice:it is few floors below the rooms. The TV in the room is small, cannot say what channel they provide, no time to watch it. In the lobby there is a seating/reading area where some people use their laptops: I suspect free WIFI internet there and i read some snacks.. i didn;t check either..Fresh apples at the reception are available. The guy at the reception is efficient, ask payment in advance and takes all your data from the passport carefully, including your home address. Is the law i guess.. so don't panic.. consider where you are: is a big city, Capital of a nation that is part of the G8 and the Vatical is inside the city as well. The ethernal city was also the heart of an empire once.. so you are entering history, when you enter in Rome, like it or not.. and is for your own safety. The cost of it is giving up some of your private data.. your call really! For late night access, you have to pop in the reception downstairs since the hotel is in a detached area in the apartment area above the reception, that is a converted shop.. the key provided won't open the entrance door but only the upstairs room area and your room.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: nellalucedelsole
Reviews.Content: My sister booked this over the internet and thank god she only booked it for two nights. We were in a room so small we could barely move around the bed to get to to door. We left as soon as possible and paid less for a much better room at a place a block away, thanks to the booking service in Termini station (I recommend you go through them, it's free and they have special deals with hotels, you pay a LOT less through them than if you book rooms yourself.) Overall, the room we booked was vastly smaller than a cheap double room usually is. I guess we were just unlucky to be given one of the crap rooms. Most hotels have a few of them!

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: 491Retired
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on comments on trip advisor. It was a good choice. The room, bedding, bathroom were spotless. Our room was a good size by European standards. A big plus, we faced the back, no view, but that was ok, because it was so quiet we thought for awhile we were the only ones on that floor. We were in walking distance to many of the main sites and felt comfortable walking in the area, even walking back after 10 pm, after taking a night tour of the city. Breakfast was adequate......nicely set out, great cappuccino. Very personable, accommodating, helpful staff. I spent a lot of time on trip advisor reading comments of a lot of hotels in Rome before choosing this one. So thanks to the people ahead os us who recommended the Caravaggio. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: irishcrowe
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed multiple Hotels via TripAdvisor and other sites for our recent trip to Rome and trying to avoid the three biggest issues associated with Rome accommodations i.e. lack of working A/C, noise and central location, we thankfully selected Hotel Caravaggio. We need not have feared as the A/C worked well and the room was in a quiet location ensuring a very sound sleep each night. Additionally, the room was clean and comfortable and maid service exceptional with all towels/soaps/toiletries etc replenished daily. Location was perfect, within walking distance to most major sites, central train/bus station, restaurants, bars, information kiosk, shopping strip and an added bonus of a convenience store a block away (open both early in the morning and late at night). The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating, especially the front desk staff and breakfast waitress. The only negative is that the breakfast breads/pastries could have been better/fresher, but I guess you cannot have it all. Overall, excellent experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBird81
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at how nice our room was, very clean and posh looking. The ensuite was clean and had a sensor light that unfortunately could pick you up when you rolled over in bed, although handy when trying to get to the bathroom at night! Shutting the bathroom door sorted out this problem. The air con was good and the reception friendly and helpful. It was wonderful having free internet access to contact home. Breakfast was nice enough, although rolls were stale at times. Make sure you check in at 2pm as if you have left your luggage with them they will charge 10 euros per bag for every hour you leave it there after 2pm! We would stay at this hotel again. A great location and could easily walk to Trevi Fountain and get a hop on hop off bus to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: caroliney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a long weekend at this hotel, we received a warm welcome, with a bottle of wine in our room. The room was very clean, airy, peaceful and quiet. Breakfast was perfectly adequate. The staff were all polite and friendly, the maid serviced the room daily. Would recommend this hotel to all. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and would be even better if the breakfast would be decent”
Reviews.Author: ThomasfromFrance
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. LOCATION - in a quiet street, near transports (3 metro stations, buses, railway) and 10 minutes walk from the east of the city center and the great areas to visit. CHECK-IN - Be careful to bring the bank card you made the booking with, because they won't let you pay with another one. The other choice is cash. ROOM - Our room was nice and quite spacious, clean and mostly quiet, as it was the one at the end of the corridor. Windows to the inner yard, which became quite animated in the early morning. But we had the windows opened, even if we could have used the air conditioning (we tried once, it was efficient). Bed was good, room was cleaned and towels changed daily. STAFF - Half of the staff was nice, some others quite rude (one guy especially), but we never asked much so we did not have much contact. SERVICE - Breakfast was not a good start of the day. A brave woman was making her best to serve, clean and make coffee alone, although she was very friendly and made good coffee (good point in Italy). She had to wash dishes very next to us, making the room quite noisy. The breakfast room was so tiny you could not move once seated, and some people had to wait to get a place. The bread was dry every morning, only orange juice and water were served. Every afternoon a glass of sparkling wine and cheap snacks were served. Internet is only available in the lobby (when it works), but we already knew that. Great to have 24/7 open desk!

Reviews.Title: “Needed a Place for 1 Night; Caravaggio Came Through”
Reviews.Author: RyanB2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is great - minutes from Termini and Repubblica... and the service is adequate. The room was neat and clean, but the refrigerator did not work at all and the A/C was sketchy. It was fair, but not somewhere we'd necesarily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: JiraMonkey
Reviews.Content: We were not scheduled to stay at this hotel but ended up here by accident when the hotel we booked had overbooked one of our nights. We were initially annoyed at having to switch hotels, but Hotel Caravaggio was terrific. The room was on the small side but not tiny, and it was gorgeous with nice furniture a beautiful mosaic tile floor. There was even a complimentary bottle of wine, which might have just been a temporary promotion but was very welcome! We did not stay for the breakfast but it looked like it would be nice. The one drawback to the room was that it did not have WiFi in the room -- however, it was available down in the lobby there was a seating area where people were gathered with their laptops to take advantage of it. Fresh apples at the reception were also a nice touch. When we moved back to our originally booked hotel the following night, we found it to be not nearly as nice!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh Rome. This hotel whispers "Rome" and shouts" value"”
Reviews.Author: Stewsonthemove
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Caravaggio is about location and a taste of Rome... quirky, different and yet an embrace from a stranger. The internet didn't work one day at all, the bathroom was small, the happy hour wasn't that happy but we absolutely loved it... It mirrored Rome. The breakfast was great an oh my god, the coffee! The room and balcony was perfect for us to come home to. The lift has to be experienced. Book a room just to get a ride in this iconic relic... The staff were lovely, really helpful with a twist of Fawlty Towers. The location is awesome, so close yet so quite. You know... I think they nailed this combination of old Rome, new service and a bit of monty python. We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay there, but was assiste by front desk”
Reviews.Author: johnmcclrty
Reviews.Content: While I didn't stay at the Caravaggio, the point of the review is to explain that the lady at the front desk was more helpful and friendly than any other service person I have run into during my travels. First she provide us with access for their wi-fi to allow us to check our email and determine the hotel we were booked at. After we still couldn't find the address where we suppose to check into she allowed us to use their phone. When the person on the other end didn't speak English she offered to talk to them for us. She finally got everything worked out and we were able to go check in. She simply did this to be kind as we were basically wasting her time otherwise. If the rest of the staff is anything like this woman, then I have to imagine staying here would be a true pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Liza1881
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as a personal recommendation, and in turn would recommend it as well. I had a very pleasant stay. Convenient location, close to everything, friendly and helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms and a very nice breakfast which you can eat on the balcony ( highlight of every morning for us). The only negative is that the wireless internet wasn't free, although it wasn't expensive, it was slightly inconvenient but overall not a big deal. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Misau
Reviews.Content: You should visit the delicious restaurant Est Est that is just 100 m far away. When leaving the hotel you turn to the left and on the next corner to the left too. Delicious pizza and chocolate cake is a must. :) Very helpful receptionist - recommending us good places for dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be recommended - rude staff and very basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2011eireontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend and two other friends within the last fortnight for 2 nights - we found the staff very unhelpful and rude (although this seems to be standard in Rome!) and the rooms to be disappointing given the price. On arrival they demanded full payment and wouldn't let us split the cost of the each room onto different bank-cards. When we saw the rooms they were very basic, small and not at all tastefully decorated. We couldn't even turn on the bathroom light as the fan made a horrific racket and the shower-bracket was broken.The breakfast was very basic (essentially bread) - the only saving grace was that the coffee was half-decent. There was only internet in the lobby, far from the rooms. When we checked out, they insist you pay €10 per room for leaving your bags (unsecured in the lobby) after 3pm - it really felt like the Ryanair of hotels with a hidden cost around every corner (although not a cheap hotel)! We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in its price range.”
Reviews.Author: ljerkaa
Reviews.Content: Great location, kindly staff, comfortable mattress, solid breakfast. Small room but comfortable to sleep. I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable hotel, cosy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Figo_123
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, well equipped with nice staff. Breakfast with a better offer than the usual continental. Situated in a nice area with walkingdistance from the major city attractions. In the evenings you dine at local restaurants nearby, away from tourist menus.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: held
Reviews.Content: if you want to be charged for additional nights then book with this hotel. The guy at reception told us that the credit card machine was broken. He used a manual credit card swiper. Oh he was freindly alright. HE CHARGED US 3 TIMES FOR A 2 NIGHT STAY. We had already arrived back home and 1 month later he decides to take money out of our account. There was a full inverstigation by our bank and whilst our money $1200 was recovered, WE WOULD NEVER EVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mini sized bedroom/bathroom, noisy, not charming at all”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Saffron
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a "Pluim Voucher", so for us the stay was for free. But I do know what this hotel usually askes for 1 night and I think it isn't worth it at all. The room we got (142) was just a little bit bigger than the bed itself and we couldn't really open our suitcases on the floor because of the lack of space. The bathroom was even smaller and when you walked out of the shower you couldn't avoid touching the toilet which was situated next to the shower. We also thougt the room was a little bit filthy: you can see how many bugs where smashed on the walls. Also the room wasn't cleaned properly. When you hang the green sign on the door, they only make up the bed but don't clean the floor. Breakfast isn't that good also, the bread and cakes are dry (8.30) and there isn't much choice. The coffee isn't fresh made, but comes from a coffee machine. In the morning the hotel is noisy. But also in the night we heard a strange sound. After examination we found out that it was te minibar. The hotel is situated on a good location, but so is every hotel which is situated in the old city center. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: nju75
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Caravaggio after it seemed the whole city of Rome was booked out due to an international convention. First they had only room for one night but then informed us by the very friendly receptionist that we could also stay another night. The hotel is located very well only 10 minutes by foot from the Train Station and 15 minutes from Via il Corso. The rooms are clean and we even had a little balcony. Our room was located on the 4th floor in a building that is also a living house. On our departure we forgot some things in the room and the hotel was so kind to send it after us. So we would really recommend this place for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience ever...Horrible unpleasant Staff, avoid to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: karma3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights and as soon as we arrived the Hotel staff was incostant, away, didn't care to give us informations or help us in any way ( we never had been in Rome before) I was given a room smelly of cigarettes and so small that we couldn't open the trolley ( medium size!), when I asked the guy at the reception to be moved he looked at us as we were too much "demanding"...eventually when we had our new room we found that the toilet didn't flush, the shower water went on and off, not to mention the noisy street. We are in our 40s and do not expect much as we usually spend most of our days out, but this Hotel for the high price you pay...yet doesn't worth it AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jeroenvangent
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Caravaggio. The deskclerk was friendly and explained how we could best travel through the city. The room was small but comfortable, the bed was good, the bathroom was clean. In the morning you can hear the noises of people waking up, walking down the hallway etcetera. This can be a problem if you like to sleep long. Breakfast was simple, but good. Final verdict: A good place to stay if you are on a citytrip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the centrum of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Jandula123
Reviews.Content: We spent in Rome 3 nights.This hotel is very well located-near to Colosseum, very clean rooms(every day roomservice).Some of them are reconstructed(really spacious rooms!),friendly staff.Every day at 5pm snack in the reception.Only breakfest was poor for european travellers.I can recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nino was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jperla
Reviews.Content: My start in Rome was not so great-my guy did not show from Iraq at the airport and I had no idea where he was. After spending the whole day at the airport waiting for him, I went to the hotel. Once there, I learned that I had no reservation and that it was cancelled because the credit card was not good (I mistyped the numbers) and that they had emailed me-went to my spam folder. Then they told me that there were no rooms. Well, I started to cry and got a little hysterical as I related all that happened that day-I hadn't slept in two days by this point. Nino was able to "handle" my outburst and find me a single room. He had also did a little bit of counseling with me and assured me that my guy would show up. My guy showed up the next day and we were able to move to a double room. That night Nino had also assured me that he would have helped me no matter if they had a room or not-he would have found me a room in Rome. This all occurred the week of Christmas. Thanks Nino. He was probably the only person in Rome that didn't try to rip me off or was rude.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible little place”
Reviews.Author: NoneLW
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms do not match the pictures on the website. I stayed there over New Year so paid way above average price, and definitely did not get what I paid for. Entrance to the rooms is via a side door which looks like the back entrance to an old takeaway shop, the lift and walls look like they could fall down at any moment. Initially I was given a horrible little shoe box for a room, to give them due when I asked to change rooms the new one was better, but both had dirty walls and showers below standard. This place needs to renovate.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: nadahope
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. However, there are so many hotels very near by, so try to stay somewhere else. In this hotel things like this happen: -cleaning lady comes in when the guests are sleeping saying "I will just clean your bathroom, I didn't know you are here" - you come back to the hotel in the evening and find the locked door and the sign on the door "I will be back soon", of course they don't come back soon and you find yourself waiting on the street... The rooms in the hotel are very small, dark (no natural light), the beds are horrible, producing horrible sounds, there is no heating in the bathroom, the TV is so old ith 4 channels only and not cable TV, the blankets are old and probably not washed for who knows how long.... This is definately not the three star hotel as mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “no frills... but clean, quiet and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stenni
Reviews.Content: Overall my mother and I enjoyed our stay here. The place was simple and clean. Pro's: five minute walk to Termini station, quiet, clean, friendly staff, good price Con's: basic breakfast (roll and espresso), super small bathroom, bed on the stiff side

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: skelley1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central to everything in Rome. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. The breakfast room was small.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money !!”
Reviews.Author: Spider72
Reviews.Content: Two mature couples, found hotel staff to be pleasant and very helpful. clean room, fresh towels and linen every day, more than adequate continental breakfast - overall good value for money. Somewhat noisy, but once windows closed and airconditioner quiet and restful. Location excellent - within walking distance to most attractions. I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average hotel - horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: KKK19
Reviews.Content: this is one of the most average hotels we have ever lived in. The reception staff are the worst people we have ever met ..... my wife's wallet was stolen and when we went to the reception to tell them about it ... they almost looked indifferent and unconcerned. The old guy on the desk (the bald one) is maybe the worst guy you can meet .... the internet in the lobby is a joke, the wifi connection is horrible and the public computer in the lobby doesnt work. and if you tell this to the reception they dont care and even look at you while they are busy browsing the internet on their computers!!!!!!!!! PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL .......

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: naomivb
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Great rooms, Great Serive, Great Location, friendly staff and there is a great local Italian restaurant around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in the Hotel Caravaggio”
Reviews.Author: Betina_9
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my friends and we had a fantastic time in this hotel. It is accessible to the main train station, the location is just a walking distance to the most particular tourist attractions. The staff speaks english well, they demostrate courteous accomodation at the reception and they make you feel welcome. The room is spacious, hot water is provided without limit especially for shower. The dining hall is cute, the breakfast meal is full of varieties; fresh croissants and biscuits, bread, fruits, yoghurt, jams, honey, cheese, etc. and they serve fragrant coffee, really smells the aroma of italian coffee. It seems that it was recently been renovated. The lobby has nice pictures, the color adopts its taste to welcome guests, a small library with many books that are available for those who want to borrow and a free fresh apples to take. I could say that what me and my friends have seen in their website are all provided. In the evening they provide a free happy hours snack, too. I can recommend this hotel to everybody who wish to enjoy Rome and feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “For a short sight-seeing trip to Rome; look no further !!”
Reviews.Author: Jolapi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Caravaggio is a charming place. Limited number of rooms, nicely furbished. The rooms we were in had absolutely no view, but that was more than made up for by the fact that that resulted in no streetnoice whatsoever. The people were all perfectly wonderful, from the reception desk attendants to the lady who served breakfast. What struck us most about the hotel is how perfectly it is located when you come to Rome to do sightseeing. The Collosseum, Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps are only a 15 minutes walk tops from the hotel. We loved the Hotel Caravaggio and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: HansMunchen
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely satisfied with this hotel. It is situated directly in the city centre and we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted. The room was really clean and tastefu fixed up, the hotel staff was kindly and helpful. During our stay we felt comfortably. We can warmly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location but small and noisy room”
Reviews.Author: sarperozge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caravaggio for two nights. The only thing good about the hotel is its location. It's very close to almost everywhere. But the room was really small even for two people. There was only one window which was pretty small, so the room was always dark during the day. The bathroom was also too small, it was only for one person. The bed was not all comfortable and it was noisy. The hotel was generally noisy. One day, we had to wake up due to the noise cause the cleaing lady were unwrapping some packages but the noise she was making was unbearable. Besides location, the coffee they served at the breakfast was really great. However, the breakfast was poor. I dont think we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there!!”
Reviews.Author: Acron
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel..its a rent a room set-up. the room was in very poor condition, wallpaper dirty and torn. Furniture in very poor condition. Only one usable power point. Only one bedside table with a broken power switch extension on the top. Behind a torn piece of wallpaper the space was stuffed with old newspapers to fill the hole. The so called bathroom was far too small, nowhere to hang towels or put toiletries. The toilet seat slipped when you sat on it and the shower had a build up of scum. The TV must be 20 years old. The garbage bins were just inside the main entrance and the stairwell walls were full of holes and in disrepair. I suggesst this place is a fire hazard and a safety concern. We thought we would be getting an average hotel room with the usual facilities as the address and hotel name sounded respectable. We feel cheated and tried to move next a.m but after trying 3 hotels in the same area which were full we decided to stay put and be far more careful with our future research. the cost was 140 euros per night which I have since found out means poor accommodation even with a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “FAKE HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: himki
Reviews.Content: Its a real fake! Pictures are fake (i.e. the entrance as on the picture does not exist!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!), three star rate is fake - it is not three star!!! My room was even without WINDOW! The single looked like a dog`s kennel

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: explr2006
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here. it was dreadful! I was a single traveller and I was positioned right next to reception.The receptionist tried to follow me into my room. I checked out straight away and stayed at a much nicer hotel- Hotel Virgilio- just down the street. It is a while since I stayed here but I really thought I should warn prospective travellers

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: Rupo
Reviews.Content: For 100 Euros a night, you can do better. Based on my 3 night stay there's no way this hotel is 3 stars. Here's why: 1. There were four power outages in my room. The main light and bathroom light were always going off. Each time, I had to report it to the front desk and although it was promptly fixed (within 10 minutes), it was a real inconvenience. 2. The toilet seat was loose enough to cause fear in any man..... 3. One day I returned to the room at 4pm to rest and it was not yet made up. Of course they arrived to clean it right after I dozed off. 4. Although the hotel is not in a bad neighborhood, it's ~200 yards or so from some not desirable places. That's not a problem, but each time I buzzed to gain entry, I was never asked my name, never queried about why I wanted in, I was just blindly buzzed into the hotel -- a potential security hazard. Good points: the room was very clean, the shower water was nice & warm and the towels were fluffy. Bottom line: shop around, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Family with 7 months old baby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Htl Caravaggio was a nice hotel, perfect location and peacefull area, just what we wanted. Room had everything that we needed, even a travel bed for our baby and a fridge that was big enough to keep babys food in cold. Room was quite small and toilet was tiny, but you don't travel to Rome to stay in you hotel, right? The elevator was really small, babys trolley barely fit in, but on the other hand if you took a stairs, you met local people - hotels reception is in 1st floor and rooms are in 4th floor, floors between were normal peoples homes! Location is great, walking distance to Roma romanum and Colosseum, Termini station and metro are also wery near, so you can see most of the city without wasting time in taxis or busses.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel in may 2006. We had room 36 on the 4th floor, it was very clean and recently renovated. The room was large but with a small bathroom and had a small balcony looking out at the patio of a Governement building, very quiet. We hardly spent any time there because the city of Rome is so beautiful and you are so close to everything. The breakfast was okay, some breads and toast, milk and orange juice and fresh coffee or tea. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We read some of these reviews before but we thought they were not true (anymore). We will advise this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights at the end of February. We had initially booked over the internet to stay at another hotel they own (Hotel Picasso) but on arrival were told that they were having some plumbing problems, so they put us up in the Caravaggio instead, which has a higher rating but they only charged us our original price (about 70 euro/night, which we thought was very good for Rome). So the staff are very honest, and for the few days we were there they were alwasy helpful. The hotel is on the first floor of a residential building, so it is secure, with buzz-in entry, and up a flight of stairs (there is a lift too). Positives: * Good location- cheaper places in Rome tend to be further away (near the Vatican), so for what we paid the location was excellent. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, 10 minutes to the main train station (Termini), 10-15 minutes to Trevi fountain. We walked everywhere and never used the metro, though I think there is a metro station nearby. The furthest walk is to the Vatican City, which takes about 45-60 minutes. It's also sort of out of the touristy area, so it's not too busy (though this was in winter), and you don't get bothered by umbrella/bag/flower sellers. It's also a nice escape from hordes of tourists. *A variety of restaurants nearby with good food at good prices, so there's a range of good places to eat without having to walk too far *Very helpful staff, who directed us to the nearest internet, laundromat, and post office. They also talked us out a tour that we were going to go on that they had heard bad things about. They are very trustworthy. *Our room was quite large, with a little balcony, and lots of space. This was especially good as we were there for a few days. *The bathroom is not huge, but is big enough, and the shower is quite good, though not the best I had on the trip, though there is a good hairdryer. *Reading other reviews, I think renovations must have been done- the floors were all new, marble, with good bedding, and the bathroom fittings were very new. Our room was actually very nice to look at and to stay in. *Breakfast is nothing fancy- a variety of breads, with conserves, juices, and a choice of coffees. It's more than enough to start off the day with. Not so good: *Some of the furniture was a bit rickety- not too bad, and we never had any problems, but rickety nonetheless. This was a great hotel to stay in given the price, the proximity to so many sights, the choice of restaurants nearby and the spacious room. I would probably stay here again- not at full price, but I think if you are paying a but less it is worth the price. The staff were very honest and helpful, and that was important to us. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Caravaggio - not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September 2005. They refinished the stairwell while we were there -- the night we arrived it looked run-down and scary, but it looked great when we left. The rooms were small and very clean. The front desk staff and the staff in the breakfast room were very friendly. The breakfast room was very small and one morning we had to wait a while to get seated. Breakfast was just rolls with jam and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the summervacation 2005. The room was large enough for the two of us. The tv had 10-some channels on it, most of them Italian but there was CNN too. The bathroom was small but good, and clean. Breakfast (only 1 time out of 5 days) was okay, not luxury but i don't think 3 stars means a lot in Rome... nothing wrong with the food though. The staff was friendly. Somewhat weird that the hotel itself is located on the second floor, but we got used to it. We always used the elevator, I loved it! We stayed on the 4th floor. The balcony was not very large, but you could sit on it with 2 people. The view was not very good, some ambasady building orso, a lot of agents walking in it. I had a great time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carzi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Caravaggio for one night but I wouldn't recommend this horrible hotel to any one! The front desk guy was very unfriendly and unreliable as he tried to charge us extra for the room. The room was really a dump and the breakfast very poor so stay elsewhere as this hotel was certaintly the worst of our 2-3 star hotel accomandation!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, just don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with a friend last year, and I thought it was a fine hotel. The rooms weren't that big, but not too small, and they were clean, or at least the sheets were. We didn't watch any tv, but I believe there were four channels. The bathroom was small but clean and functional, and the shower was fine. There was enough water for two persons to take a shower 3 times a day, anyway. I personally didn't mind the small rooms and corridors, but we weren't there that much. We didn't have breakfast there (I agree that was terrible), but there was an nice bakery around the corner with cheap rolls. I also thought the staircase was very nice looking, and it didn't bother me at all. There was a very slow and somewhat stupid person behind the 'reception' (a desk with some papers on it) who wanted to charge us for using the airconditioning and breakfast. When we explained we didn't use it, we didn't have to pay for it. We payed cash, by the way, so no extra charging for rooms afterwards. We payed 35 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Broken furniture, freezing cold, the WORST I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Ernest
Reviews.Content: In Rome for New Years, this was the only reserv I could get. The 1st room had busted-up furniture. The sofa arms were totally broken from the seats-just leaning on the base. Filthy as well. After changing to another room things didn't pick up. The place was so cold we had to spread our clothing on the bed to keep our teeth from chattering. Nasty place - how do they stay in business?

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Forevermemories
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caravaggio, Rome, is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We have traveled extensively but this hotel surpasses the "Terrible" rating shown. Service is non-existent. Cleanliness is a joke. AC does not work. Linens have holes in them. Closets/armoire with its broken wire hangers is a broken cupboard that was probably picked up from a garbage dump. The elevator is a terror with open wire cage and electrical wires exposed. The hallways are unmarked and a definite fire trap. Plumbing malfuntioned much of the time. Hot water was occasional. The shower sprayed water everywhere including on the electrical outlet and light. Holes in the floor. AC did not work so window facing the street was opened which let in the noise from the nightclub across the street. Bugs from open window. Breakfast was served in a dirty, dismal room with disgusting food and undrinkable coffee. Chipped dishes. Juice served in a broken plastic pitcher. Avoid this food. Don't stay in this hotel. If your travel agent tries to book you, refuse. Nothing about this hotel is worth more than $10 US per night, if that! Pre-purchased through RailTour for $200 per night. Complained to RailTour and did not get a response. Hopefully RailTour will remove this hotel from their list.

Reviews.Title: “BIG DUMP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a gut feeling to tell the taxi driver to keep going and find ourselves another hotel. Its on the 1st floor of this building with a nasty entry. We got there and the guy tells us that the credit card machine is broken and that we would have to pay cash. He insisted but when my husband and I said we were going to leave, he said that maybe the machine would work again. The bedcover was filthy with cigarette holes all over it. The blanket was completely stained with I don't know what! The breakfast room was tiny and they couldn't even make us a cappucino because they wouldn't get the machine fixed. Very cheap. DON'T stay here. if you do, ask for a confirmation letter with the rate and the # of nights you are staying so they don't rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “hotel caravaggio billing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in Rome, and an ok stay at this hotel. Bedding was old and a/c didnt work that well...But when I got home was the surprise. They have billed me twice. I have corresponded via email, only now they send my emails back. So apparently I will be out the additional money. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Caravaggio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palermo 73, 00184 Rome, Italy
